title: Studio access and supervision
body:
Draft policy. Reservations are required for every visit so work areas remain safe and predictable.

  • Access details are shared in the portal after account setup.
  • Supervised equipment may require staff approval before use.
  • Guests or observers must be pre-approved.

title: Safety and kiln handling rules
body:
Draft policy. All kiln submissions must be clearly labeled and ready for production handling.

  • Include clay body and firing intent on each batch.
  • Pieces must be dry and construction-ready for firing.
  • Unsafe or unclear submissions may be delayed until corrected.

title: Clay and materials policy
body:
Draft policy. Use approved clay bodies and communicate unfamiliar materials before submission.

  • Unknown materials may be held for review.
  • Material issues that cause defects are treated as maker-side faults.
  • Ask support before introducing new tests into production loads.

title: Firing cadence and scheduling
body:
Draft policy. Firing requests run through the portal queue and studio load planning.

  • Typical turnaround is about 1.5 days, with pieces unloaded after firing.
  • Queue times vary by batch mix and current load volume.
  • Expedite or custom firings are reviewed case by case.

title: Storage and abandoned work
body:
Draft policy. Most completed work is picked up within about 2 weeks, but storage can extend to 4 weeks.

  • Normal pickup pattern: roughly within 2 weeks.
  • Maximum hold window: up to 4 weeks before abandoned-work handling.
  • Notification attempts are made before any disposition steps.

title: Damage responsibility and firing credits
body:
Draft policy. Ceramics always carry firing risk, but credits are issued when fault is clearly studio-side.

  • If fault is studio-side (for example loading error or wrong firing type), the impacted half-shelf bisque or glaze fee is fully credited.
  • If fault is maker-side (for example dryness, construction/process fault, or miscommunication on firing temperature), no firing credit is issued.
  • Witness cones are available on request, and a portal add-on workflow is planned.

title: Payment timing and accepted methods
body:
Draft policy. Payment timing depends on service type.

  • Supplies, day passes, and workshops are charged immediately.
  • Workshop charges are processed at attendance, not reservation.
  • Firing fees are charged at unloading after studio-fault review.
  • Tap, credit card, and Apple Pay are accepted.

title: Community conduct and shared-space expectations
body:
Draft policy. We maintain a calm, respectful production environment for all members and clients.

  • Respect shared equipment, timing blocks, and posted safety notes.
  • Harassment, intimidation, or repeated disruption is not allowed.
  • Staff may pause access when safety or conduct issues require intervention.

title: Accessibility and communication standards
body:
Draft policy. Support is client-first and accessibility-minded.

  • Support response target is 1 business day.
  • Media accessibility standards are documented in the accessibility and media policies.
  • Clients can request accessibility support through the contact and support channels.
